snippet: The World Food Program of the United Nations said in a statement that 1.1 million people are at risk of hunger and that their plight could worsen.
abstract: United Nations officials report that 1.1 million people are at risk of hunger in Central African Republic and say their plight could worsen due to poor harvests and economic collapse from political violence.
lead_paragraph: The World Food Program of the United Nations said in a statement that 1.1 million people are at risk of hunger and that their plight could worsen.

headline.main: Central African Republic: Violence Increases Hunger Risk, U.N. Warns
headline.print_headline: Central African Republic: Violence Increases Hunger Risk, U.N. Warns
